intro: Ageratina rosei, commonly known as the rose muhly, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, fluffy white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a delicate appearance. Ageratina rosei typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its aesthetic appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
